snippet: Restaurant owners like Eric King have been highly critical of the employer health insurance mandate, and he said the rule’s delay “gives us another year to plan.”
abstract: Restaurant owners with 50 full-time employees or more are highly critical of employer health insurance mandate outlined in Obama health care law, and are relieved at rule's one-year delay; owners like Eric King of Shanty Grille in Ellicott City, Md, say that postponement will give them more time to figure out how to offset costs of providing all employees with health insurance.
lead_paragraph: Restaurant owners like Eric King have been highly critical of the employer health insurance mandate, and he said the rule’s delay “gives us another year to plan.”

headline.main: At Restaurant, Delay Is Help on Health Law
headline.print_headline: At Restaurant, Delay Is Help On Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
